comment_data.body: would it simplify things we just bailed out of diff-mode entirely? I don't think we need to bother trying to construct partial "guessed" result.
can use `t.dedent()` to make this look nicer :)

comment_regular_data.body:
This is definitely wanted, thanks! Typically the way to check for ctrl-c is one of the breakcheck functions https://github.com/neovim/neovim/blob/b923fcbaf06276051372c17177a9970c4adc8e3d/src/nvim/os/input.c#L210-L228

E.g. if this is in a very hot loop, use `veryfast_breakcheck`. Does that not work?
@jwhite510 can you rebase this? any thoughts on my comment above?

@justinmk 
rebased, and now using the the veryfast_breakcheck, that's exactly what I was looking for.
Needs a rebase, and a test. And hopefully the code will be much simpler after removing the attempt to "guess" when the user cancels.
sorry for missing this, if you can rebase and CI looks good let's merge it.

title: feat(diff): cancel linematch if ctrl-c is pressed while it's running
